title: The Planets
author: Gail Gibbons
description: An informative introduction to the planets in our solar system, with colorful illustrations and easy-to-understand explanations about each planet's unique characteristics and features.

title: A Hundred Billion Trillion Stars
author: Seth Fishman
description: A mind-blowing exploration of the vastness of space, teaching young readers about the incredible numbers of stars, planets, and galaxies in our universe.

title: Margaret and the Moon
author: Dean Robbins
description: The inspiring true story of Margaret Hamilton, the brilliant computer programmer who helped Apollo 11 land on the moon by writing the code that prevented a computer crash.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The magical story of Harry Potter, an orphaned boy who discovers he's a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he faces the dark wizard Voldemort.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The adventure of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on an epic quest with dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from the dragon Smaug, discovering courage and friendship along the way.

title: Percy Jackson & The Olympians: The Lightning Thief
author: Rick Riordan
description: Percy Jackson discovers he's the son of Poseidon and must prevent a war between the Greek gods by finding Zeus's stolen lightning bolt in this modern mythology adventure.

title: Eragon
author: Christopher Paolini
description: A farm boy named Eragon discovers a dragon egg and becomes a Dragon Rider, destined to fight against the evil king Galbatorix in the magical land of AlagaÃ«sia.

title: The Golden Compass
author: Philip Pullman
description: Lyra Belacqua journeys through parallel worlds with her daemon Pantalaimon to rescue kidnapped children and uncover a sinister plot involving mysterious particles called Dust.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
description: Four children discover the magical world of Narnia through a wardrobe, where they must help the great lion Aslan defeat the White Witch and restore peace to the land.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
description: In a seemingly perfect society without pain, war, or suffering, twelve-year-old Jonas discovers the dark truth about his community when he's chosen to receive all of humanity's memories.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: Brilliant child prodigy Ender Wiggin is recruited to Battle School to train for an alien invasion, but he discovers the true nature of his final test in this gripping science fiction tale.

title: National Geographic Readers: Planets
author: Elizabeth Carney
description: Stunning photographs and fascinating facts about all the planets in our solar system, perfect for young space enthusiasts who want to learn about planetary science and astronomy.

title: The Magic School Bus Lost in the Solar System
author: Joanna Cole
description: Ms. Frizzle takes her class on an incredible field trip through space to explore the planets, moons, and other celestial bodies in our solar system with humor and scientific accuracy.

title: Hidden Figures
author: Margot Lee Shetterly
description: The untold story of the brilliant African-American women mathematicians who played crucial roles in NASA's early space missions and helped win the space race.

title: A Wrinkle in Time
author: Madeleine L'Engle
description: Meg Murry travels through time and space with her brother and friend to rescue her father from an evil force, learning about love, courage, and the power of individuality.

title: Wonder
author: R.J. Palacio
description: August Pullman, born with facial differences, enters fifth grade for the first time and learns about friendship, kindness, and acceptance in this heartwarming story about being different.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
description: A brilliant girl with telekinetic powers overcomes neglectful parents and a tyrannical headmistress using her intelligence, courage, and newfound abilities.

title: The Wild Robot
author: Peter Brown
description: When robot Roz awakens on a remote island, she must learn to adapt and survive in the wilderness while caring for an orphaned gosling in this touching story about nature and belonging.

title: Hatchet
author: Gary Paulsen
description: Thirteen-year-old Brian survives alone in the Canadian wilderness for 54 days with only a hatchet as his tool, learning crucial survival skills and discovering inner strength.

title: The One and Only Ivan
author: Katherine Applegate
description: Ivan, a silverback gorilla living in captivity at a mall, tells his story of friendship, art, and hope as he works to save his friend Ruby, a baby elephant.

title: Bridge to Terabithia
author: Katherine Paterson
description: Jesse and Leslie create an imaginary kingdom in the woods called Terabithia, but their friendship faces an unexpected tragedy.

title: Hatchet
author: Gary Paulsen
description: After a plane crash, 13-year-old Brian must survive alone in the Canadian wilderness with only a hatchet as his tool.

title: The Maze Runner
author: James Dashner
description: Thomas wakes up in a mysterious place called the Glade, surrounded by a massive maze, with no memory of his past.

title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
author: Jeff Kinney
description: The humorous journal of Greg Heffley as he navigates the challenges of middle school.

title: Where the Red Fern Grows
author: Wilson Rawls
description: Billy works hard to save money for two hunting dogs, and together they become the best hunting team in the Ozark Mountains.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Set in Nazi Germany, this is the story of Liesel, a young girl who steals books and shares them with others during the horrors of World War II.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins, a comfortable hobbit, is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug.
